tsp

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • tsp.Path
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A Path is used to store a specific travel route through all vertices. This is done with help of an int array which holds the index values a VertexSet. The order of how to travel the vertices can then simply be retrieved by iterating through the array from the beginning to the end. Additionally, each Path is able to store its fitness in form of a double value. The fitness is always being calculated in relation to all the other paths in the population.
    Author:
    Roman Boegli

      • Path

        public Path(int nVertices,
            boolean lShuffle)
        constructor I, used to initiate paths
        Parameters:
        nVertices - indicates the length of the path
        lShuffle - shuffles the order if set to true intensively

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Path clone()
        creates a clone of a Path with help of the constructor II
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • mutate

        public void mutate(double nMutationRate)
        swaps values in the int array Order randomly according to the mutation rate
        Parameters:
        nMutationRate - Should be a value between 0 and 1 indicating how much percent of the path may be affected through mutation. Mutation will be performed by means of the .shuffle() method.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns:
        length of the path

      • get

        public int get(int i)
        retrieves the value of a specific element in the path's Order array
        Parameters:
        i - index of the element being retrieved
        Returns:
        array value as an integer

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo()
        method used to get information about a path in form of a one line string.
        Returns:
        the specific order of vertices, indicated by their indices (index based), and the current fitness as a one line info string

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo(VertexSet vs)
        method used to get detailed information about a path in form of a one line string.
        Parameters:
        vs - VertexSet on which the path applies
        Returns:
        the specific order of vertices, indicated by their names (name based), current fitness and total distance as a one line info string

      • getFitness

        public double getFitness()
        gets the path's fitness
        Returns:
        Fitness as a double value between 0 and 1. The higher the value the better the path

      • setFitness

        public void setFitness(double nFitness)
        sets the path's fitness
        Parameters:
        nFitness - value between 0 and 1, whereas a higher value is considered as better
